intro: Ecbolium chamaeranthemoides, commonly known as the rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to rocky and arid regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in crevices and on slopes, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually basal, linear, and covered with a fine layer of hair. Ecbolium chamaeranthemoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to stabilize soil in harsh environments.
